channel.title: Give 'Em Hell Devils
channel.description: A Photoblog of Arizona State Sun Devil Baseball

item.title: Landon Hairston at the Plate
item.description: Landon Hairston steps in during a key trip to the plate in Saturday's 3-1 win over St. Johns, a tight pitching duel that pushed the Sun Devils to a 6-0 start on the season. Through the first two weekends, Hairston is leading the Devils with a .409 average (9-for-22), a 1.227 OPS, 10 RBI and 2 stolen bases. He sits in the top four on the roster in every major offensive category and currently leads the team in Hits and Doubles.
item.author: Barry S. Stahl

item.title: Nuʻu Gets Ready for Omaha
item.description: On a warm afternoon at Phoenix Muni, Nuʻu Contrades gets loose before the start of play against Omaha. Through the first two games of the 2026 season, the junior infielder has been a force at the plate, hitting .500 with a double and a grand slam in Saturday’s win. He’s also been perfect in his nine defensive chances at second base, providing steady play in the middle of the diamond. A strong start for a veteran Sun Devil who knows exactly where this team wants to be when June rolls around.
item.author: Barry S. Stahl

item.title: Kyle Walker Goes Airborne
item.description: On a day where he went 3 for 5 with a HR and 3 RBIs at the plate, Redshirt Junior Kyle Walker gets the put-out at 2B before spinning to continue the play. The Sun Devils beat the Cougars, 13-3.
item.author: Barry S. Stahl

item.title: Congratulations Kole Calhoun on a Great MLB Career
item.description: Sun Devil 4 Life, Kole Calhoun, announced his retirement from MLB on Friday night after 12 seasons. In his time at ASU, Kole became know as "The Mayor of Omaha", due to his performance at the College World Series in 2009 where he was named to the all-tournament team. Congratulations on an amazing career Kole Calhoun!
item.author: Barry S. Stahl

item.title: Isaiah Jackson
item.description: We're expecting big things from 6'3" sophomore Isaiah Jackson this year.
item.author: Barry S. Stahl

item.title: Tobi Kicks off a New Season
item.description: It is appropriate that we re-launch this site and its corresponding social media presence with an image of our favorite Sun Devil, Jacob Tobias, who kicked-off the 2024 season leading ASU's powerful offense. In 16 plate appearances against Santa Clara during the opening weekend, Tobi had 7 hits including 2 HR and reached-base 9 times for an OPS of 1.563.
item.author: Barry S. Stahl

item.title: Congratulations to Andrew Romine on his 11 Year Career
item.description: Andrew Romine, best known for being the 5th player in MLB history to play all 9 positions in a single game, has announced his retirement after 11 seasons in the Majors. Romine played 3 seasons with the Sun Devils, playing alongside fellow major leaguers like Brett Wallace, Eric Sogard, Ike Davis, Travis Buck and Tuffy Gosewisch. Enjoy your retirement Andrew.

item.title: Fall Baseball 2021
item.description: ASU Baseball's fall session is here, so let's take a look around the diamond at the players that will be on the roster under new head coach and Sun Devil for Life, Willie Bloomquist. Our first look is at Adam Tulloch, the starter for Saturday's 16 innings of fall ball against the Dirtbags of Long Beach State.
item.author: Barry S. Stahl

item.title: Torkelson's 2019 Tournament Hits
item.description: This YouTube video shows every hit that Spencer Torkelson got during the Sun Devil's appearance in the 2019 NCAA tournament regionals. Oh what could have been in 2020.
item.author: NCAA Championships

item.title: Another Sun Devil Goes to the Tigers
item.description: Another Sun Devil that will be on the Detroit Tigers Major League Roster very soon is Gage Workman. According to Mike Axisa of CBSSports.com, the Tigers "...flat out store Arizona State infielder Gage Workman in the fourth round." contributing to the Tigers' outstanding draft. Detroit's gain is our loss. Thank you for the outstanding years at ASU Gage, we look forward to seeing you on TV in a Tigers uniform soon.
item.author: Barry S. Stahl
